name: Pop-Free CB 4 Quiz | Common Bond 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: Korat, American Curl and LaPerm are breeds of...
questions.explanation:
Cats.

	As you might imagine, the American Curl and LaPerm have curly coats.

questions.text: Which of these natural fibers is strongest?
questions.explanation:
Silk.

	A strand of silk is stronger than a strand of steel of similar diameter.

questions.text:
What word could be paired with each of the following words (either before or after it) to make a 2-word phrase?
Democratic
Animal
Favors
questions.explanation:
Party.

	Democratic party, party animal, party favors.

questions.text: Which wool fabric is soft, usually made from worsted wool, and has a "nap," or fuzz, on one side only?
questions.explanation:
Flannel.

	Tweed is a heavy material usually used for making jackets and coats. Gabardine is a smooth fabric used for pants. Felt is made from non-woven, matted fibers.

questions.text: What is the title of a book by Elie Wiesel that details the experiences of a Jewish teenager in a concentration camp during WWII?
questions.explanation:
Night.

	This book is usually regarded as being autobiographical. Although brief, it is a moving and harrowing work.

questions.text: What is the most common British slang term for what is known in the USA as soccer?
questions.explanation:
footy & footie.

	It's short for "football", of course.

questions.text: Which of the following is the smallest unit of scoring in a tennis competition?
questions.explanation:
Game.

	The match is made up of sets, and the set is made up of games. In men's tennis, for example, a match may be made of five sets, of which each set is made up of several games.

questions.text: In physics, what kind of collision has no loss of kinetic energy?
questions.explanation:
Elastic.

	Remember those experiments in high school where you swung one of a set of swinging balls and allowed it to hit the other, watching what happened? That's one of the closest approximations of an elastic collision that you can actually see.

questions.text: Another term for suburbs is _______________ communities.
questions.explanation:
Bedroom.

	Typically, these are communities that spring up on the fringes of large cities.

questions.text: So what do all of these answers have in common?
questions.explanation:
Pajama & pajamas & pyjama & pyjamas.

	Pajamas are usually worn in the bedroom. Silk and flannel are pajama materials, and many pajamas have elastic waistbands. Footy pajamas are a type of pajamas with built-in slippers. Pajamas are usually worn at night. To be "the cat's pajamas" is to be truly outstanding. "The Pajama Game" is a famous American musical. A pajama party is a sleepover party, usually for kids.
